SEARCH
Package Logic

Class Board

java.lang.Object
Logic.Board
public class Board extends Object
Board is a class that represents the game board. It manages the cells, score display, and bonus score display.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Default constructor for the Board class. Initializes the board with a default size.

    • Board

      public Board(int[][] matrix)
      Constructs a new Board instance based on a given matrix. The matrix represents the layout of the board, where: 0's represent walls, 1's represent open tiles, 2's represent the entrance, and 3's represent the exit. The board is transposed during initialization, effectively rotating it 90 degrees.
      Parameters:
      matrix - The 2D integer array representing the layout of the board.

    • Board

      public Board(int width, int height, Position entrancePosition, Position exitPosition)
      Constructor for the Board class. Initializes a 2D array of cells with the given width and height. All cells are initially set to EMPTY, except for the border cells which are set to WALL. Also sets the entrance and exit cells based on the provided positions.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the board.
      height - The height of the board.
      entrancePosition - The position of the entrance cell.
      exitPosition - The position of the exit cell.

      Loads the board.

    • updateLocations

      public void updateLocations(List<Monster> monsters, Cyborg cyborg, List<Reward> rewards, List<Punishment> punishments)
      Updates the locations of all game entities on the board. This method first clears all cell occupants, then sets the occupants of each cell based on the positions of the monsters, cyborg, rewards, and punishments.
      Parameters:
      monsters - The list of monsters in the game.
      cyborg - The cyborg in the game.
      rewards - The list of rewards in the game.
      punishments - The list of punishments in the game.

    • updateScoreDisplay

      public void updateScoreDisplay(int score)
      Updates the score display.
      Parameters:
      score - The score to display.

    • updateBonusScoreDisplay

      public void updateBonusScoreDisplay(int bonusScore)
      Updates the bonus score display.
      Parameters:
      bonusScore - The bonus score to display.
